technology: There were no technical difficulties during the conversation.
cur_neg_affect: The participant does not express much negative affect about the pandemic in the present, mainly focusing on the importance of research and trusting science.
past_neg_affect: The participant recalls feeling some skepticism and uncertainty about the vaccine initially, but this is relatively mild.
communal_orientation: The participant actively listens to their partner, asks follow-up questions, and expresses understanding, showing a moderate level of communal orientation.
engagement: The participant is very engaged in the conversation, sharing their experiences, asking questions, and responding thoughtfully to their partner's comments.
defensiveness: The participant does not display any defensiveness in justifying their beliefs or perspective.
questions: (05:55-05:02): I don't know what your thoughts are on, whether or not you think this is like truly over.
(06:55-06:58): Was your experience like with vaccination?
(09:36-09:43): What was your sequence of shots like?
(11:30-11:33): Did you ever do modify as if you ever got Covid?
(14:13-14:19): Is that something you would try in the near future, or you're just like I don't see it being beneficial to me right now.
(15:25-15:31): I wanted to ask. I'm curious about your decisions about vaccination and boosters in the near future.
(16:17-16:20): If I were ever to get another shot right, do you think you would try a yearly Covid Booster shot?
perspective_statements: (13:51-13:52): Hey? Yeah, no, that. Yeah. It's so strange to see.
(13:52-14:02): How it affects different people differently. You know they could have gotten like the same vaccine, the same like that sequence of it, and everything.
similarity_statements: (06:58-07:07): I think it was similar or when it first started to come out, there was a bit of hope and a bit of skepticism mixed because, like you said, vaccines often take quite a bit of time to develop, and then at least 5 to 10 years.
(12:22-12:31): Yeah, yeah. Actually, around the same time, I had a an internship in New York City over the summer. And like, 3 days after getting there, I tested positive I was like.
vaccine_importance: The participant clearly states that they are a fan of vaccination, especially during public health crises, indicating that they believe vaccines are extremely important.
booster_importance: The participant expresses willingness to get yearly COVID boosters if that's what is recommended, showing that they believe boosters are very important.
cognitive_complexity: The participant demonstrates a moderate amount of cognitive complexity by considering different perspectives, acknowledging the nuances of vaccine development and efficacy, and weighing the pros and cons of getting boosters.
general_notes: The participant is very open to vaccination and boosters, but also emphasizes the importance of research and trusting science.
